title: Jack Kerouac
summary: Jean-Louis Lebris de Kérouac[1] (/ˈkɛruæk/;[2] March 12, 1922 – October 21, 1969), known as Jack Kerouac, was an American novelist and poet[3] of French Canadian ancestry,[4][5][6] who, alongside William S. Burroughs and Allen Ginsberg, was a pioneer of the Beat Generation.[7]
